intro: Nabalus barbatus, commonly known as the Barbatus Nabalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, woolly leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found growing in rocky soils and along the edges of shrublands. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
